The amendments made by this section will take effect after the suspension period ends under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. SEC. 4. FLOOR STOCK REFUNDS. Under the floor stock refunds provision, if tax has been imposed on liquid before the tax suspension date and is held by a dealer for sale, the taxpayer can claim a credit or refund for the excess tax paid. Claims must be filed within 6 months of the tax suspension date with the Secretary of the Treasury. Under the floor stock refunds provision, a taxpayer can claim a credit or refund for excess tax paid on liquid held by a dealer before the tax suspension date. The dealer must submit a request for refund or credit within 3 months of the tax suspension date, and the taxpayer must repay or agree to repay the amount claimed. No credit or refund is allowed for liquid in retail stocks intended for retail sale. Definitions for "dealer" and "held by a dealer" are provided in this section. The terms "dealer" and "held by a dealer" are defined in section 6412 of the Internal Revenue Code. The tax suspension date is the start of the suspension period under section 4081(f) of the Code. Rules similar to those in section 6412 apply to this provision. SEC. 5. FLOOR STOCKS TAX. Imposition of Tax: A floor stocks tax is imposed on taxable liquid held on the floor stocks tax date, calculated as the excess of the tax that would be imposed under specific sections of the Internal Revenue Code on the liquid over the tax already paid. Liability and Payment: The person holding the liquid is liable for the tax, to be paid as prescribed by the Secretary within 6 months of the floor stocks tax date. The floor stocks tax is imposed on taxable liquid held on the floor stocks tax date. Definitions include terms like "taxable liquid," "gasoline," "diesel fuel," and "aviation fuel." The floor stocks tax date is the day after the suspension period ends. The term "date" refers to the day after the suspension period under section 4081(f) of the Code. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Treasury or delegate. The tax imposed by subsection (a) does not apply to taxable liquid held for exempt uses or in the tank of a motor vehicle or motorboat. No tax is imposed on gasoline held on the floor stocks tax date. The exemption applies to gasoline up to 4,000 gallons and diesel fuel, kerosene, or aviation fuel up to 2,000 gallons held by a person submitting required information to the Secretary. Fuel exempt from tax under subsection (d) or (e) is not considered. The term "controlled group" under subsection (d) or (e) means all persons treated as 1 person, with regulations for nonincorporated persons under common control. Principles similar to those in subparagraph (A) apply to a group of persons under common control, even if not all are corporations. Other laws, including penalties, applicable to specific fuel taxes also apply to floor stock taxes imposed under subsection (a).
